employee.name: Dr. A K Mahabub Kamal
employee.about: Dr A K Mahabub Kamal was an outstanding student and when he was in the fifth grade, he took an interest in Science and decided to become a heart surgeon. In the fifth grade, Dr A K Mahabub Kamal heard about a South African surgeon who had performed the world’s first heart transplant. Dr A K Mahabub Kamal was amazed at this surgery and began reading about it in depth. He became inspired by this surgery and decided to pursue further education in Medicine and change people’s lives.

employee.name: Dr. Ferdous Shahriar
employee.about: With expertise in arthroscopic and complex shoulder and elbow reconstruction, he utilizes state-of-the art surgical techniques and the latest technologies to treat the entire spectrum of shoulder and elbow injuries and problems. Each year, he performs close to 400 shoulder replacements, over 150 arthroscopic rotator cuff surgeries, and has become the regions leading tertiary referral center for complex shoulder and elbow problems. He is the highest volume shoulder replacement surgeon in the country. As a regional leader in Shoulder & Elbow Surgery, he became a member of the prestigious American Shoulder and Elbow Surgeons.

employee.name: Dr. A M Rezaul Haider
employee.about: He has been exposed to all ranges of cranial emergencies starting from trauma to intracerebral hematomas and strokes; entire ranges of emergency spinal decompression, stabilization and fusion; full spectrum of routine cases like brain tumors (supra and infratentorial, intra or extra axial), trans-sphenoidal surgery for sellar - suprasellar tumors, spinal tumors; congenital and pediatric neurosurgical disorders; degenerative spine diseases; endoscopic neurosurgical procedures; vascular disorders like aneurysms and AVMs. He has multiple publications in national and international journals.

employee.name: Dr. S M Mahabub Kamal
employee.about: Many of our out-of-state patients gladly make a trip to see us because they have experienced how much better they feel living with an exceptionally artistic and accurate prosthesis versus a less impressive one they might have initially received closer to their home. We are also making our services more convenient every year as we develop new locations across the country. With our new “digital distance service” we can even design our prosthetics entirely based on CT scans or impressions sent to our main facility. The list of possibilities is growing each year.
